results.title: His Royal Highness
results.creator_credit: F.W. Thring and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: George Wallace plays a stage-hand who dreams that he is King. This is Efftee’s third feature and the first all Australian talking musical film. Some lively songs and an ingenious comic performance by George Wallace. Cast also includes Mona Barlee, Marshall Crosby, Lou Vernon.

results.title: His responsibility?
results.brief_description: Ronnie aged 18, learns that his girlfriend is pregnant. Abortion? Illegitimacy? Keeping the baby? Adoption? Marriage? He must decide what his responsibility is. This film helps teenagers preview the consequences of irresponsible actions, as they affect themselves and others.

results.title: His own kind of dignity
results.brief_description: Looks at the problems of some developing countries, namely the Philippines, Indonesia and Papua-New Guinea. Explores some development programmes assisted by foreign aid from Asia Fund for Human Development. Narrated by Peter Bergin.

results.title: His mother's voice
results.brief_description: Using as its source a radio interview from the ABCs current affairs program, The World Today, in which a Queensland mother recounts how she came to learn of her sons shooting in 1995, Dennis Tupicoff explores terrain somewhere between documentary and animation. As an animator he gives an added dimension to the documentary nature of his subject matter by dividing the film into two halves, one an animated re-enactment of the crime, the other an understated lyrical and visual poetic presentation of the overwhelming nature of grief. This short film is both compelling and powerfully affecting.

results.title: His first climb
results.brief_description: Begins by showing basic climbing equipment, including boots, helmet, carabiner, chocks and ropes. Shows techniques such as the use of ropes, specific knots and the running relay. Stresses the need for three-point contact with rockface at all times and the necessity for an experienced instructor.

results.title: Hiroyuki Iwaki
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Personalities of Today”.
Shows day to day life of renowned Japanese conductor, Hiroyuki Iwaki as he is interviewed by music critic, Marcel Grily. Includes background scenes of city/country life in Japan and also shows Iwaki conducting in various European cities. Features the NHK Symphony Orchestra, Tokyo.

results.title: Hiroshima & Nagasaki: the harvest of nuclear war
results.creator_credit: Masami Hayakawa, Naoyuki Jinnouchi and Iwanami Productions
results.brief_description: Outlines the horrific effects of the two atomic bombs dropped on the small cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki in August 1945. With the aid of some contemporary footage, the film shows the devastating psychological and physiological results on the populace, both immediately and in the following months and years after the war. Includes footage of a visit by Pope John Paul II. Also mentions the huge stockpiling of thousands of far larger bombs in the decades since World War II.

results.title: Hiroko Ikoko
results.brief_description: Two little Japanese girls go for a stroll after school to look for beautiful tropical fish which they had been studying and drawing in school. Their search leads them to the pools of a formal garden and to the glass aquariums of street markets. Their parents, who have become anxious over their prolonged absence, go searching and find them. Many glimpses of Tokyo are seen.
